citation.case_name: Berkshire Fine Spinning Associates, Inc. v. City of New York

html:
361 U.S. 3

80 S.Ct. 86

4 L.Ed.2d 51

BERKSHIRE FINE SPINNING ASSOCIATES, Inc.
v.
CITY OF NEW YORK et al.

No. 272.

Supreme Court of the United States

October 12, 1959

Mr. Truman Henson, for appellant.

Mr. Stanley Buchsbaum, for appellees.

PER CURIAM.

1

The appeal is dismissed for want of a substantial federal question.

2

Mr. Justice HARLAN and Mr. Justice WHITTAKER are of the opinion that probable jurisdiction should be noted.
html_lawbox:
361 U.S. 3 (1959)

BERKSHIRE FINE SPINNING ASSOCIATES, INC.,
v.
CITY OF NEW YORK ET AL.

No. 272.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided October 12, 1959.
APPEAL FROM THE COURT OF APPEALS OF NEW YORK.

Truman Henson for appellant.

Stanley Buchsbaum for appellees.

PER CURIAM.

The appeal is dismissed for want of a substantial federal question.

MR. JUSTICE HARLAN and MR. JUSTICE WHITTAKER are of the opinion that probable jurisdiction should be noted.
